channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SUREFIRE-1197] Surefire 2.19 breaks tests under Windows due to fork problem
item.description:
After switching from Surefire 2.18.1 to 2.19 our tests under Windows have stopped working (Linux and Mac are still running fine). The only error message is

Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-surefire-plugin:2.19:test (default-test) on project server.ejb: Error occurred in starting fork, check output in log -> [Help 1]

(Full stacktrace below).

Is checked the log and even enabled full debug messages but there is not indication whatsoever what the problem can be. Given that everything worked perfectly fine until we switched to 2.19 this seems to be a bug in this version. I'm happy to provide further details if you tell me what you need and how I can acquire it.

=======================
org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-surefire-plugin:2.19:test (default-test) on project server.ejb: Error occurred in starting fork, check output in log
at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute(MojoExecutor.java:212)
at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute(MojoExecutor.java:153)
at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute(MojoExecutor.java:145)
at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleModuleBuilder.buildProject(LifecycleModuleBuilder.java:116)
at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleModuleBuilder.buildProject(LifecycleModuleBuilder.java:80)
at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.builder.singlethreaded.SingleThreadedBuilder.build(SingleThreadedBuilder.java:51)
at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleStarter.execute(LifecycleStarter.java:120)
at org.apache.maven.DefaultMaven.doExecute(DefaultMaven.java:355)
at org.apache.maven.DefaultMaven.execute(DefaultMaven.java:155)
at org.apache.maven.cli.MavenCli.execute(MavenCli.java:584)
at org.apache.maven.cli.MavenCli.doMain(MavenCli.java:216)
at org.apache.maven.cli.MavenCli.main(MavenCli.java:160)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:95)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:55)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:507)
at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.launchEnhanced(Launcher.java:289)
at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.launch(Launcher.java:229)
at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.mainWithExitCode(Launcher.java:415)
at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:356)
Caused by: org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoFailureException: Error occurred in starting fork, check output in log
at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.SurefirePlugin.assertNoException(SurefirePlugin.java:326)
at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.SurefirePlugin.handleSummary(SurefirePlugin.java:316)
at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.AbstractSurefireMojo.executeAfterPreconditionsChecked(AbstractSurefireMojo.java:880)
at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.AbstractSurefireMojo.execute(AbstractSurefireMojo.java:739)
at org.apache.maven.plugin.DefaultBuildPluginManager.executeMojo(DefaultBuildPluginManager.java:132)
at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute(MojoExecutor.java:208)
... 19 more
Caused by: org.apache.maven.surefire.booter.SurefireBooterForkException: Error occurred in starting fork, check output in log
at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.booterclient.ForkStarter.fork(ForkStarter.java:559)
at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.booterclient.ForkStarter.fork(ForkStarter.java:461)
at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.booterclient.ForkStarter.run(ForkStarter.java:229)
at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.booterclient.ForkStarter.run(ForkStarter.java:201)
at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.AbstractSurefireMojo.executeProvider(AbstractSurefireMojo.java:1014)
at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.AbstractSurefireMojo.executeAfterPreconditionsChecked(AbstractSurefireMojo.java:850)
... 22 more
item.summary: Surefire 2.19 breaks tests under Windows due to fork problem

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
sithmein
It will be a problem in forked JVM. Can you attach target/surefire-reports in Jira and provide a project where I can reproduce this issue?
Thx.

sithmein
thor
I have a fix but I need you to confirm it's working.
It is in my branch https://github.com/Tibor17/maven-surefire/tree/surefire-1193

Build Surefire 2.20-SNAPSHOT and check it out with your project.
$ git -b surefire-1193 clone https://github.com/Tibor17/maven-surefire.git
$ cd maven-surefire
$ mvn install -DskipTests
Thanks! I will try it tomorrow.

Unfortunately your fix didn't resolve the issue. I also cannot send you the project because it's closed source code. I'm trying to isolate the problem with a minimal test but this may take a few days. Now that I have the source code I'm also happy to debug it. Do you have any pointers where to start?
I also noticed that the fork error comes after all tests have run successfully.

Not necessary to debug it.
Please extract "surefire.local.repository.zip" from SUREFIRE-1193 in your local repo and use Surefire Version 2.20-SNAPSHOT in your project.
This produces *.txt files in some target folders of your project.
Generated file names start with surefire-finished1, surefire-finished2, surefire-error-ite, surefire-error-t1, surefire-error-t2.
Please extract the zip in your Maven local repository (perhaps your repo is mapped to ~/.m2/repository/), run the project again and upload the files as a zip to Jira. I will analyze it.
Thx.

Did as you described, but I don't find any of the files that you mentioned anywhere in my projects. Only the usual *Test.txt files with the results for each test class. I'm sure I'm using 2.20-SNAPSHOT because the fork error message shows this version number.

Make sure you use the right local repo path.
Override it again.
Launch the Maven build in offline mode.

mvn -o test

Most probably the snapshot version was downloaded from web using another
content.

On Tue, Nov 24, 2015 at 4:10 PM, Thorsten Meinl (JIRA) <jira@apache.org>

Sorry, but I can't get it to work the way you described. What I did:

  • Removed my complete local m2 repository
  • Run the tests with surefire 2.19, this fills the local repository with version 2.19
  • Extracted the Zip you linked above into my local repository
  • Ran the tests in offline mode. Then Maven complains it cannot find the surefire plug-in version 2.20-SNAPSHOT (although I see it in the local repository)

Then I ran mvn install on the sources of your private branch. After that I could run the tests with 2.20-SNAPSHOT but no additional files were created. I extracted the ZIP file again, overwriting all existing files. Same result, no additional files after running the tests.

Where did you extract the zip in ~/.m2/ or in ~/.m2/repository/ ?
The tilda (~) stands for your user home.
The default local repository in Maven is ~/.m2/repository/

For instance my user home is "C:\Users\tibor17" and thus the repo is
C:\Users\tibor17\.m2\repository

This means cd ~/.m2/repository/ (put your absolute path)
unzip <zip file>
check if 2.20-SNAPSHOT appears now in subfolders of ~/.m2/repository/ which
is surefire.

If you want to make sure the repo is exactly the default one in user home,
open command line and specify local repo path (C:\Users\tibor17) in Windows
set MAVEN_OPTS=-Dmaven.repo.local=C:\Users\tibor17\.m2\repository
mvn -o test

If you have white space in user home, use "".

On Thu, Nov 26, 2015 at 11:14 AM, Thorsten Meinl (JIRA) <jira@apache.org>

I'm sure I extracted everything in the correct folder. As I said I deleted everything in ~/.m2/repository and then it got re-populated so it must be the correct folder .m2 folder. Also I don't see an "org" folder in .m2 but only in .m2/repository.

.m2/repository is expected.
Do you have settings.xml in .m2 ?
If you do, have a look and see the element <localRepository>
There is the path to your local repo.

On Thu, Nov 26, 2015 at 11:37 AM, Thorsten Meinl (JIRA) <jira@apache.org>

sithmein
thor
I don't know how to help you more. As I said the zip file must be extracted in ".m2/repository" and not in ".m2". If we do not find the fix now, you should wait for a new release Version 2.19.1.

After renaming all jar files from your archive that have a timestamp in their names to "SNAPSHOT" I finally got it to work. However, the only file that is created is a "surefire-finished1.1728077946.txt" with the only content "finished normally". The fork error still occurs.

I fixed SUREFIRE-1193 and the fixed version 2.20-SNAPSHOT should be
available in Maven central. Is not this issues the same with SUREFIRE-1193?

On Sun, Nov 29, 2015 at 1:15 PM, Thorsten Meinl (JIRA) <jira@apache.org>
No, the current master code does not fix the forking issue under Windows.

I want to reproduce this issue. What should I do?
Can you isolate project dependencies and attach project to Jira?
Thx.

On Sun, Nov 29, 2015 at 2:48 PM, Thorsten Meinl (JIRA) <jira@apache.org>

I really would give you access to everything, but as I said it's closed source, requires a complex setup and licenses, etc.
I did some debugging and I think I found the cause. We install a JVM shutdown hook that deletes temporary files. This may take quite some time and there is a noticeable delay after the last testcase and the final result messages (5-10 seconds). While the temp files are deleted by the shutdown hook, the "ping" job, which is installed via ForkedBooter.createPingJob, is called and triggers an exit of the JVM with exit code 1. The reason why we don't see the same behaviour on other OS is that they are much faster in deleting the temporary files (faster machines and faster file system). I hope this helps you in fixing this issue. If you need additional information (e.g. stacktrace, etc.) just ask.

ugh, that's very good info. I was expecting other similar error that
surefire hangs.
We have two timers. One is the ping timer checking if main process of Maven
is still alive and the second is pretty old started on shutdown hook and
killing the VM while non-daemon threads hangs in user's tests.
We must find some solution.
Question. Is your shutdown hook located in src/main/java or src/test/java.
We don't want to introduce new configuration parameters as our general
restriction, but I am thinking of system property used in <argLine/>.
Let's see what is faster to come over this issue.

On Sun, Nov 29, 2015 at 5:35 PM, Thorsten Meinl (JIRA) <jira@apache.org>

Maybe there's another problem.

Are all tests completed and the fork fails few seconds after the last test
has finished?

Because the ForkStarter should wait as long as the last fork VM is alive.
Then ForkStarter should send ping without any interruption.
I think that ForkStarter makes some assumption that the last test was
finished and therefore latest VM is dead.
It's only a guess but probable hypothesis.

On Sun, Nov 29, 2015 at 5:44 PM, Tibor Digana <tibordigana@apache.org>

How long your shutdown takes?
Can you measure the period?
Second timer kills VM after 30 seconds.

On Sun, Nov 29, 2015 at 5:55 PM, Tibor Digana <tibordigana@apache.org>
The ping timer kills the forked JVM after the very last test has finished. Deleting the files temp takes ~10 seconds and somewhere in between the JVM is killed.
... and the shutdown hook is part of the normal application lifecycle (not limited to the tests) and therefore it's in src/main/java (of another project, though).
commit c733075bc90bcd6e07cdc60c24fa5c833e14cf6e

SUCCESS: Integrated in maven-surefire #1515 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/maven-surefire/1515/)
SUREFIRE-1197 Surefire 2.19 breaks tests under Windows due to fork (tibor17: rev c733075bc90bcd6e07cdc60c24fa5c833e14cf6e)

  • surefire-booter/src/main/java/org/apache/maven/surefire/booter/ForkedBooter.java
  • surefire-providers/surefire-junit4/src/main/java/org/apache/maven/surefire/junit4/JUnit4Provider.java
  • surefire-providers/surefire-testng/src/main/java/org/apache/maven/surefire/testng/TestNGProvider.java
  • surefire-providers/surefire-junit47/src/main/java/org/apache/maven/surefire/junitcore/JUnitCoreProvider.java
This project has moved from Jira to GitHub Issues. This issue was migrated to apache/maven-surefire#2492.
